I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_List: General basic knowledge about organic chemistry.
I learned what organic chemistry was and what it entailed. I also learned a lot about how certain molecules interact and why they interact in those ways.
I learned how to draw, manipulate, and react organic compounds. I also learned many terms used to describe the properties of organic molecules such as polar, chiral, meso, etc.
I learned a lot by taking this course including a ton of different mechanisms for reactions and how these different reactions take place.
I really pushed myself to use new study materials such as flashcards and a dry erase whiteboard. A skill I will use going forward when trying to memorize and comprehend material
I learned the fundamentals of organic chemistry.
I learned the fundamentals of Organic Chemistry and in general, better study habits for high-volume STEM courses.
excellent professor, problem solving sessions could be less helpful as the TA only taught one way to solve a problem and failed to recognize other ways of solving them.

I thought it was fast paced, but understandably so. I thought the practice problem sessions were very helpful and similar to what we saw on a test. The material was organized and taught very, very well. One way it could be improved is by having more material in our grades; it would be nice if the tests were weighted less and there was some sort of homework grade (maybe even optional homework grade).

strengths - availability and willingness of Dr. D and Dr. M to answer questions and help us as much as they can. 
weakness - I'm not sure there were any.
I think the course was laid out well so that the new material we learned built on what we had learned previously.

I liked how intense the course was due to the condensed timespan. It was a lot to keep up with, but it helped me really understand the material. The only weakness I would mention is that the last bit of information, for exam three, was given very quickly without much time for us to absorb it before the final. I would have liked to have spent less time on the review material for exam one and more time on the material for exam three. But overall the course was very good and I enjoyed it! Another HUGE strength was Dr. DiMeglio. She was so sweet and encouraging; she really made the course amazing.
The course was very engaging and made so we can understand the material as easily as possible.
A successful crash course of organic 1. Prepared me very well for organic 2, and covered what seemed like all the relevant material in a short amount of time.
This class moves very quickly, making it difficult to fully learn all of the material.

Organic Chemistry over the summer is incredibly difficult due to the pace of the course and the accelerated intake of knowledge. If taken during the school year, perhaps better study techniques involving long-term learning and understanding may be utilized, but because we were learning a chapter a day at some points, students were pretty much required to commit to cramming and straight memorization to prepare for exams.
Yes if they are interested in chemistry and have the time, or if they need it for PreMed or a major requirement. It was very difficult but understandably so.
of course, especially with Dr. D. You obviously have to study a lot and everyday because it's so much content crammed into five weeks, but definitely a decision that I do not regret.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in chemistry. I thought it was taught well and I liked the material.

YES! I was worried about taking a course this intense over the summer and all I can say is IT WAS WORTH IT. I felt like I was able to understand the material just as well, if not better, than I would have taking this course during the semester. Dr. DiMeglio made it clear she wanted all of us to succeed in our personal goals for taking the course and she was always super accommodating and helpful. Most of us students were taking the class as part of the pre-med track and she was super understanding and even directed the course towards the information likely to be presented on the MCAT. So, if you're on campus for the summer and want to get a hard class out of the way, yes, I would definitely recommend Organic Chemistry.
Yes. Fulfills medical school requirement.
Yes. Dr D was a very effective teacher and the course was a great way to handle a challenging course in a more timely and intense, yet doable fashion.
Taking orgo over the summer was a great choice because it allowed me to devote more time to the course.
If you need to take it for pre-med or for the chemistry major only.
